name: ListAdyenCheckoutGateways
description:
Retrieve all gateways supported by the current configuration of Adyen, matched with the existing payment types in EVA. `ID` is it's unique
identifier, `Name` is something that you can show the customer.

It is required to supply an `OrderID` or, the `CurrencyID` and `Amount`.
When no amount is given, the open amount of the order we be used.
It is recommended to specify the `Channel`:
- Web: 1
- iOS: 2
- Android: 3

Recommended way of calling this service is with only an `OrderID` and `Channel`.

* If present, the `Details` list will show a list of properties that this gateway supports. Every detail is identied with the `Key`, and to support
typed inputs, the `Type` is also given. If the `Type` is `select`, one of the items inside the `Items` list needs to be chosen. Here, again, the
`ID` is it's unique identifier, and the `Name` is something you can show the customer.
* If present, the `Brands` list will show a list of supported brands within this payment method, e.g. to list creditcards (mc, visa, amex, ...).

When creating the payment, use the `ID` of the gateway as `GatewayID`. Fill the payment properties `Details` with the properties specific to the
gateway, as indicated by this response's `Details` list.
auth_description: This service does not require authentication.

headers.name: EVA-User-Agent
headers.description: The user agent that is making these calls. Don't make this specific per device/browser but per application. This should be of the form: `MyFirstUserAgent/1.0.0`

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnitID
headers.description: The ID of the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-Requested-OrganizationUnit-Query
headers.description: The query that selects the organization unit to run this request in.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-Mode
headers.description: The IDs mode to run this request in. Currently only `ExternalIDs` is supported.

headers.name: EVA-IDs-BackendSystemID
headers.description: The ID of the backend system that is used to resolve the IDs.

B.name: CurrencyID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Currency`

B.name: OrderID
B.description: This is the ID of a `Order`

D.name: Code
D.description: A unique ID identifying this error.

D.name: Message
D.description: A human-readable message describing the error.

D.name: RequestID
D.description: A unique ID identifying the request. Please provide this ID when contacting support.

D.name: Type
D.description: A short description of the error type.

E.name: Issuers
E.description: Requires at least v68 of the adyen integration

E.name: PaymentTypeID
E.description: This is the ID of a `PaymentType`

G.name: ExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the resolved external IDs.

G.name: IsAsyncResultAvailable
G.description: This is a flag indicating whether the async request is done. If it is `null`, it is not an async service. If it is `false`, the response is not yet available. Do not process the properties in that case. It is is `true` the properties are filled with the result of the call.

G.name: UnresolvedExternalIDs
G.description: When using the `ExternalIDs` mode, this will hold the external IDs we couldn't resolve.
